member.name: EXPLORER_BROWSER_OPTIONS
member.summary: These flags are used with and .

member.name: EXPLORER_BROWSER_OPTIONS.EBO_NAVIGATEONCE
member.summary: Do not navigate further than the initial navigation.

member.name: EXPLORER_BROWSER_OPTIONS.EBO_SHOWFRAMES
member.summary: Use the following standard panes: Commands Module pane, Navigation pane, Details pane, and Preview pane. An implementer of can modify the components of the Commands Module that are shown. For more information see, . If EBO_SHOWFRAMES is not set, Explorer browser uses a single view object.

member.name: EXPLORER_BROWSER_OPTIONS.EBO_ALWAYSNAVIGATE
member.summary: Always navigate, even if you are attempting to navigate to the current folder.

member.name: EXPLORER_BROWSER_OPTIONS.EBO_NOTRAVELLOG
member.summary: Do not update the travel log.

member.name: EXPLORER_BROWSER_OPTIONS.EBO_NOWRAPPERWINDOW
member.summary: Do not use a wrapper window. This flag is used with legacy clients that need the browser parented directly on themselves.

member.name: EXPLORER_BROWSER_OPTIONS.EBO_NOBORDER
member.summary: Introduced in Windows Vista. Do not draw a border around the browser window.

member.name: EXPLORER_BROWSER_OPTIONS.EBO_NOPERSISTVIEWSTATE
member.summary: Introduced in Windows Vista. Do not persist the view state.
